banana.name: Banana
banana.summary: Bananas are commonly used in smoothies for natural sweetness and a creamy texture. This page is informational, not medical advice.
highlights: Naturally sweet; pairs well with cocoa, peanut butter, oats
Helps thicken smoothies without added sugar
Contains potassium and fiber

peanut-butter.name: Peanut Butter
peanut-butter.summary: Peanut butter is a popular smoothie add-in for richness and satiety. Choose options with minimal added sugar if possible. Informational only—not medical advice.
highlights: Adds creamy texture and nutty flavor
Common in high-calorie or protein-style smoothies
Pairs well with banana, cocoa, oats, and milk/plant milk

blueberries.name: Blueberries
blueberries.summary: Blueberries are widely used in smoothies for flavor and color. Fresh or frozen both work well. Informational only—not medical advice.
highlights: Easy fruit base for many smoothie recipes
Pairs well with yogurt, oats, spinach, and banana
Works great frozen for thickness

spinach.name: Spinach
spinach.summary: Spinach is a common green-smoothie ingredient because it blends smoothly and is mild in taste when mixed with fruit. Informational only—not medical advice.
highlights: Mild flavor; easy to 'hide' in fruit smoothies
Pairs well with banana, berries, and yogurt
Often used as a starter green for beginners

strawberry.name: Strawberry
strawberry.summary: Strawberries are commonly used in smoothies for sweetness and a bright flavor. Fresh or frozen both work well. Informational only—not medical advice.
highlights: Classic smoothie fruit; easy to combine with banana and yogurt
Frozen strawberries help thicken smoothies
Pairs well with oats, chia, and spinach

avocado.name: Avocado
avocado.summary: Avocado is used in smoothies for a creamy texture and mild flavor. Informational only—not medical advice.
highlights: Adds creaminess without dairy
Pairs well with cocoa, banana, and berries
Common in green smoothies with spinach or kale

chia-seed.name: Chia Seed
chia-seed.summary: Chia seeds are added to smoothies for texture and to thicken when soaked. Informational only—not medical advice.
highlights: Can thicken smoothies if allowed to sit
Pairs well with berries, oats, and yogurt
Often used in fiber-focused blends

kale.name: Kale
kale.summary: Kale is used in smoothies as a stronger-tasting leafy green than spinach. Pair with fruit for balance. Informational only—not medical advice.
highlights: Stronger flavor; best balanced with banana or berries
Common in green smoothies
Pairs well with avocado and citrus
